Name: Abysseans
Description: Water-breathing humanoids who explore space in exoskeletons.

Name: Ananos
Description: Bulky, mole-like creatures tantalized by the treasures found below-ground.

Name: Benthosa
Description: Sentient bodies of water composed of the consciousnesses of the life forms within them.

Name: Calceans
Description: Mechanical recreations of an extinct species.

Name: Cephalons
Description: Gelatinous, tentacled beings that share a symbiotic relationship with their host bodies.

Name: Chimaven
Description: Bird-like beings obsessed with the sky.

Name: Cimexeans
Description: Insect-like humanoids who share a hive mind.

Name: Cumulusareans
Description: A friendly, cloud-like species of artists.

Name: Espereans
Description: Psionics advocating for intergalactic peace.

Name: Frigoreans
Description: Resurrected humanoids who value equality.

Name: Herbaceans
Description: Sentient plants who rarely leave their collectives.

Name: Humans
Description: The restless explorers of the cosmos.

Name: Informeans
Description: Gelatinous spheres who poop fuel and are super nice to everyone.

Name: Loricatoreans
Description: Tiny humanoids who travel the galaxy in android exoskeletons.
Drawback: Outside of their suit, d4 for Grit, Fight, and Flight

Name: Mystarians
Description: Nomadic, all-female mystics who wield The Bind.

Name: Neozo
Description: Animals given human qualities and, generally, bad attitudes.

Name: Pantheros
Description: Once worshiped as gods, now sought for their ability to create energy.

Name: Proeleans
Description: Warlike humanoids who seek galactic domination.

Name: Pugnarean
Description: Tricksy, technologically-advanced shapeshifters.

Name: Quillarians
Description: Tiny bio-organic engineers, healers, and fuzzy hug monsters.

Name: Raskog
Description: Sleeping hominids, frozen in time.
Drawback: d4 for Charm, 1 if d4 already

Name: Reptilnae
Description: Small, reptilian creatures with 360 vision and a flair for blending in.
Drawback: Add 1 to severity of an attack

Name: Skitchlings
Description: Mouthless, gangly beings often hired for covert missions or their skills at dance.

Name: Sollemneans
Description: Serious, emotionally-cold humanoids.

Name: Squillians
Description: Bipedal shrimp originally bred for consumption.

Name: Therinians
Description: Intelligent bears who live in peaceful, rule-driven collectives.

Name: Throggofel
Description: Diminutive, often-cyborg tinkerers obsessed with technology.

Name: Viscoseans
Description: Symbiotic gels looking for a willing host.
